thread.title: Pete Evans threatens to leave MKR after row with a contestant
thread.title_full: Pete Evans threatens to leave MKR after row with a contestant

title: Pete Evans threatens to leave MKR after row with a contestant
text:
Pete Evans threatens to leave MKR after row with a contestant Last updated 21:54, February 13 2017 JAMES BRICKWOOD/FAIRFAX AUSTRALIA 
Chef and staunch supporter of the paleo diet, Pete Evans. 
My Kitchen Rules judge Pete Evans has come to blows with a contestant and threatened to walk away from filming this season. 
Josh, nicknamed the Seafood King, took things "too far" when he said a paleo diet is "rubbish", the Daily Mail reported . 
Evans is very pro-paleo and things came to a head when Josh said paleo was "a bunch of b....". 
"No one had ever seen Pete like this before; he was so angry and wouldn't calm down," an on-set source reportedly said. 
READ MORE: * Paleo Pete Evans given award which recognises 'quackery' 
"Pete is incredibly sensitive about paleo and refuses to talk about it on set. He doesn't see what it has to do with the show." 
The final straw was when Josh reportedly mocked Pete and asked him if he thought he was being a 'hypocrite' for breaking his preferred diet for the show. 
The celebrity judge said he would leave if the "arrogant and antagonistic" 25-year-old wasn't put in his place, according to Woman's Day . 
"He told producers he wanted them to call Josh in and read him the riot act," a source allegedly said. "It was stop bullying Pete or else he'd be out." 
The paleo diet typically includes vegetables, fruits, nuts, roots, meat and organ meats. It excludes foods such as dairy products, grains, sugar, legumes, processed oils, salt, and alcohol or coffee.
